thread.section_title: Central Florida Political Pulse - Orlando Sentinel
thread.title: Mayor's race: Dyer challengers respond to 'State of Downtown' speech
thread.title_full: Mayor's race: Dyer challengers respond to 'State of Downtown' speech

author: Jeff Weiner
title: Mayor's race: Dyer challengers respond to 'State of Downtown' speech
text:
Political Pulse Your political and regional news source Mayor's race: Dyer challengers respond to 'State of Downtown' speech Jeff Weiner Contact Reporter 
After Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer delivered his "State of Downtown" speech Thursday, his two opponents for re-election weighed in, accusing the incumbent of putting his priorities ahead of those of citizens. 
Paul Paulson, the veteran and businessman who is Dyer's chief challenger according to polling and spending data, said Dyer has "promoted his 'vision' for downtown by building edifices to millionaire developers and sports team owners at the expense of our city's neighborhoods." 
"In walking door-to-door and meeting thousands of Orlando voters, I can tell you with certainty that the taxpayers do not share in Mr. Dyer's shortsighted vision," Paulson added. "Dyer has the City floating on a sea of red ink and installed the largest tax increase in Orlando's history to help fund these boondoggles." 
He continued: "My vision is not one of a 'world class downtown' but one of world class neighborhoods." 
Sunshine Linda-Marie Grund's response referenced a lighter moment in Dyer's speech, when he shooed away several local sports mascots: "To use your highness own words: away with you," Grund said. Orlando Mayor Dyer delivers State of Downtown address 
Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer delivered the State of Downtown address Thursday at the Citrus Bowl calling it a "half time pep talk." (Fox35 Video) 
Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer delivered the State of Downtown address Thursday at the Citrus Bowl calling it a "half time pep talk." (Fox35 Video) See more videos 
"It was a good end of game speech," she said. "Just as he thanked Mayor [Bill] Fredrick for service - I will be sure to give credit and thankfulness for his work with the city. Unlike the mayor I know that the true head coach of our city is the citizens." 
She continued: "The commissioners and myself are the assistant coaches. I look forward to implementing the winning plan for our future with a diverse team. Diversity is key and we need more diversity in representation. Teamwork will move us forward with promise, peace, and purpose."
